ng to put together a test coverage metrics reporting tool, and
want
to know=
 if anyone has tried doing this yet. (I'm sure someone has.)

what to=
 do is generate a report that shows some stats on how many
classes
have tes=
t cases and how many methods in the class under test have
corresponding tes=
t methods.  I have tried it a few different ways: 

1. Just scanning throug=
h the source folder, picking up the java files
and
then checking if a ?Test=
.java file exists in a corresponding unit test
folder.  

This approach wor=
ks well if I only cared about the file coverage, but I
now
want info on the=
 method coverage.  Enter method 2.  

2. Use a tool that will parse through=
 the java source and tell me all

the problem with it is that I can

 a time, and javadoc is not so nice

 to get info on the methods in

lass an interface, I would
